text: Hey <@UATE4ATHP>, this is possible if you use the CLI. See HubSpots boilerplate theme on GitHub (they give module repeater defaults in the code)
Can the file manager provide warnings to HubSpot users about images over 4096px?
This would save me and my clients a lot of time spent in emails
Hi John, thanks for your post. As a brief intro - I'm the product manager for our file management tools.
To make sure I understand the situation and use case - is this specific to when you are trying to upload images for email?
How would the warning help in your workflow?

<@U3T21PDBK> I've seen that. And tried it, but it doesn't seem to work properly. It shows the defaults I've set in the editor, but doesnt pull in on that front end. and when I made one change to the repeater in the editor, in then pushes the defaults I've set. It's super strange...

Not for email – but in every scenario that someone uploads an image. Because the `resize_image_url` function does not work on images over 4096px.

Clients keep getting dinged in their Google Page Speed score and then they email me complaining. I have to explain to them that HubSpot can’t resize images over 4096px. In every scenario this is new information to the client. I don’t expect every client to look this up in HS documentation, therefore they should at least be given a warning message if they upload an image wider or taller than 4096px
I didn't know the 4069px limit but I'd love this too, please. I had a client the other day using 8MB images (16000px files) for each thumbnail on their blog listings page... I wanted to cry.
Interesting… probably a bug in your code. Try uploading the module from their template and see if you can reproduce the same scenario
Pretty sure there are more than one places that you have to put the default content

Yeah. Trust me I've tried everything haha. Made even made it a global module, set the defaults in the IDE. Downloaded it with the CLI. But once make it not global and upload it back via CLI, the defaults get set back to that.

Me too...just had a client that filled a HS default gallery with 4k Images. The whole page had a file size of 24MB. I think it would be good to have the possibility to give a general size limit to images as i can´t see a use case where images really need to be 4000px wide.

I think a warning would suffice. 
You never know when a client might need a huge image, either in quality (DPI) or resolution. 
Could be for purposes such as press photos, photography for print, etc. that would require more. 
The more flexibility, the better.
